issue.title: Not getting updates/website detecting Adblocker every time now

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://gaypornhdfree.com/?ref=mygaysites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
I have uninstalled and reinstalled the Adguard app multiple times could doing that interfere with getting updates? Or could that cause the base filter that Alex added a new code specifically for gaypornhdfree.com to no longer work? My iPhone is iPhone 7 Plus operating system 15.7.1 safari version 15.7.1

All I know is now if I click the updating button on the adguard app it saids no updates found. And the website is now detecting my adblocker every time no matter how many refreshes of the page I do. Could someone also please tell me what are the exact filters I must have enabled for in safari protection of the app in order for the added code Alex did to work? 

I have set up the six Adguard extensions on settings-safari of Aduard custom-Adguard general-Aduard other-Adguard privacy-Adguard security-Adguard-social 

each one is enabled 

I have gone to gaypornhdfree.com selected the aA icon on the left of the url bar of safari picked manage extensions and made sure adguard was enabled for advanced protection

I also clicked on adguard on the list shown when you click aA and checked to make sure safari protection specifically for that website is enabled

I have went also to setting-safari and selected

delete history and website data I have also selected close tabs afterwards 


I have added the user rule that Alex told me to add I have done everything I believe I was told of the exact order

but just in case could someone please direct me to the steps again of the exact order 

to make sure I have not missed a step or done it in the wrong order





2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

If someone could please respond of the exact order of the steps needed for this to work I could implement then immediately 


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
It would be useful to check that the site and its iframes do not ban IPs.

In part, this can be ruled out as with disable all AG Protection the message does not disappear.

If it doesn't disappear, you'd have to check if your public IP changes when you activate airplane mode or restart your home router. Finally, use a VPN as long as it is not in a domain blocked for VPN.

issue.title: Not getting updates/website detecting Adblocker every time now

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://gaypornhdfree.com/?ref=mygaysites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
I have uninstalled and reinstalled the Adguard app multiple times could doing that interfere with getting updates? Or could that cause the base filter that Alex added a new code specifically for gaypornhdfree.com to no longer work? My iPhone is iPhone 7 Plus operating system 15.7.1 safari version 15.7.1

All I know is now if I click the updating button on the adguard app it saids no updates found. And the website is now detecting my adblocker every time no matter how many refreshes of the page I do. Could someone also please tell me what are the exact filters I must have enabled for in safari protection of the app in order for the added code Alex did to work? 

I have set up the six Adguard extensions on settings-safari of Aduard custom-Adguard general-Aduard other-Adguard privacy-Adguard security-Adguard-social 

each one is enabled 

I have gone to gaypornhdfree.com selected the aA icon on the left of the url bar of safari picked manage extensions and made sure adguard was enabled for advanced protection

I also clicked on adguard on the list shown when you click aA and checked to make sure safari protection specifically for that website is enabled

I have went also to setting-safari and selected

delete history and website data I have also selected close tabs afterwards 


I have added the user rule that Alex told me to add I have done everything I believe I was told of the exact order

but just in case could someone please direct me to the steps again of the exact order 

to make sure I have not missed a step or done it in the wrong order





2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

If someone could please respond of the exact order of the steps needed for this to work I could implement then immediately 


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> It would be useful to check that the site and its iframes do not ban IPs.
> 
> In part, this can be ruled out as with disable all AG Protection the message does should disappear (but back ads/annoyances/tracking).
> 
> If it doesn't disappear, you'd have to check if your public IP changes when you activate airplane mode or restart your home router. Finally, use a VPN as long as it is not in a domain blocked for VPN.
> 
> I'd rather not play around with remote access either.

Could I at least share my screen by zoom or something?

### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://toonights.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftoonights.com%2F) ### Comment Username: `@ycngmn` > The pops up happen only in the video player page. > > Steps to produce: > > — Go to any movie/series page > — Tap on the yellow play button > — Tap anywhere on the screen. > > Note : Need to register with mail in order to play a video ( can use tempmail ) ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/P8iXVuR.jpg)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/8A68KpS.png)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- Platform: | Android 12 AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Android v4.0+nightly+35+(79) Browser: | Yandex AdGuard mode: | VPN Filtering quality: | High-quality HTTPS filtering: | enabled Stealth mode: | disabled DNS filtering: | server: `System`
filters: `https://filters.adtidy.org/android/filters/15_optimized.txt` Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads

issue.body:

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://gaypornhdfree.com/?ref=mygaysites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Quick reminder if you want me to stop making issue tickets than stop not responding anymore on the ones already made again I am paying for AdGuard so I don’t understand why I have to make multiple issue tickets just to get a response now with that out of the way 

Okay, so I’m gonna try this way you all seem to be having no issue Alex, BlazDT, Zolyden,yougotskinny, and Krystian watching multiple videos on gaypornhdfree.com with your AdGuard active so clearly the issue is not with Adguard than it’s either with my phone, my internet provider, internet protocol, or I just didn’t follow the steps exactly and or in the correct order 

So please thoroughly explain the step by step process and the order of the process you did to accomplish Adguard never being detected when trying to play videos on gaypornhdfree.com

if I can determine with your help that I have now with confirmation followed the steps to the letter that you all followed to accomplish this,

than I can check this one off and realize it’s an issue with my phone, internet provider, or my internet protocol, 

but I want know unless one of you explains thoroughly what you did of step by step and the order to make gaypornhdfree.com never detect AdGuard each time, 


So please respond as asap with the detailed instructions of what you did 
2. Screenshots

</details>

comment.body: Safari API can be a bit troublesome. Therefore update all filters, wait until all messages like converting are gone, add one rule to user filter. Wait until all messages are gone again and try again. If not working, add the next one and try again (and so on).

issue.title: petel.bg
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://petel.bg](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fpetel.bg) ### Comment > The ads are loaded from url ad.petel.bg ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/cYnmiQy.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- Platform: | AdGuard DNS Browser: | Chrome Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Mobile Ads

comment.body: Given how the ads from that domain are blocked by `/www/delivery/` in AdGuard Base Filter in regular adblockers, thus meaning that *Bulgarian List* doesn't have a standalone `||ad.petel.bg^` entry, I'd say there are good grounds to add `||ad.petel.bg^` to https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardSDNSFilter/blob/master/Filters/rules.txt

issue.title: DuckDuckGo analytics domain
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

T

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

F

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard German filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Hello!
I have a domain that periodically receives requests when using the search engine DuckDuckGo.

`improving.duckduckgo.com`

I propose to add it to the blocklist.

**Steps to reproduce:**
_Open Duckduckgo -> Type any search query -> Scroll to the bottom and back again_

issue.title: Rules clean up
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Safari

### AdGuard version

 C

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other(specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Ctf

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Japanese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Hello!
In the rules located at the link https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/SpywareFilter/sections/tracking_servers.txt

The same rule is stated twice. Once it is commented out, the second time it is not.

I suggest removing the commented version.

**Here is commented version (line 10):**
![A1C90660-4FB7-49D0-91EF-CAE12E006FAA](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/120200229/206930873-3f0c16e5-ed5e-41ed-8772-ed411fecf9da.jpeg)

**And here is not:**
![C49EFF0F-086A-4FE9-9990-F51A2581C9D4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/120200229/206930882-3ab5fffe-1f37-4627-9972-515dd615f2f6.jpeg)


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition
